trans-unit.source: Creates a shortcut (.lnk) to a file.

seg-source.mrk: Creates a shortcut (.lnk) to a file.

target.mrk: Creates a shortcut (.lnk) to a file.

trans-unit.source: Full path and file name of file to which the shortcut will point.

seg-source.mrk: Full path and file name of file to which the shortcut will point.

target.mrk: Full path and file name of file to which the shortcut will point.

trans-unit.source: Full path and file name of the shortcut.

seg-source.mrk: Full path and file name of the shortcut.

target.mrk: Full path and file name of the shortcut.

trans-unit.source: [optional] Full Path/File name of icon to use.

seg-source.mrk: Full Path/File name of icon to use.

target.mrk: Full Path/File name of icon to use.

trans-unit.source: [optional] Hotkey - same as the Send() key format.

seg-source.mrk: Hotkey - same as the Send() key format.

target.mrk: Hotkey - same as the Send() key format.

trans-unit.source: [optional] The state the shortcut is launched in. Use either @SW_SHOWNORMAL, @SW_SHOWMINNOACTIVE or @SW_SHOWMAXIMIZED

seg-source.mrk: The state the shortcut is launched in.

target.mrk: The state the shortcut is launched in.

trans-unit.source: Hotkeys for windows shortcuts are of the following form: Ctrl+Alt+X, Ctrl+Shift+X, Shift+Alt+X, Ctrl+NumPadKey, or Alt+NumPadKey where X represents a letter, number, punctuation, or function key. If you specify an invalid form, Windows typically defaults to Ctrl+Alt

seg-source.mrk: Hotkeys for windows shortcuts are of the following form:
Ctrl+Alt+X, Ctrl+Shift+X, Shift+Alt+X, Ctrl+NumPadKey, or Alt+NumPadKey where X represents a letter, number, punctuation, or function key.
If you specify an invalid form, Windows typically defaults to Ctrl+Alt

target.mrk: Hotkeys for windows shortcuts are of the following form:
Ctrl+Alt+X, Ctrl+Shift+X, Shift+Alt+X, Ctrl+NumPadKey, or Alt+NumPadKey where X represents a letter, number, punctuation, or function key.
If you specify an invalid form, Windows typically defaults to Ctrl+Alt

trans-unit.source: Note that Windows distinguishes number pad keys from regular number and punctuation keys. FileCreateShortcut() allows you to create Ctrl+X and Alt+X shortcuts (which Windows normally only allows when X is a NumPadKey); however, you should avoid these assignments as they may conflict with standard application hotkeys.

seg-source.mrk: Note that Windows distinguishes number pad keys from regular number and punctuation keys.

FileCreateShortcut() allows you to create Ctrl+X and Alt+X shortcuts (which Windows normally only allows when X is a NumPadKey); however, you should avoid these assignments as they may conflict with standard application hotkeys.

target.mrk: Note that Windows distinguishes number pad keys from regular number and punctuation keys.

FileCreateShortcut() allows you to create Ctrl+X and Alt+X shortcuts (which Windows normally only allows when X is a NumPadKey); however, you should avoid these assignments as they may conflict with standard application hotkeys.

trans-unit.source: Windows prohibits ESC, ENTER, TAB, SPACEBAR, PRINT SCREEN, SHIFT, or BACKSPACE from being used in hotkeys.

seg-source.mrk: Windows prohibits ESC, ENTER, TAB, SPACEBAR, PRINT SCREEN, SHIFT, or BACKSPACE from being used in hotkeys.

target.mrk: Windows prohibits ESC, ENTER, TAB, SPACEBAR, PRINT SCREEN, SHIFT, or BACKSPACE from being used in hotkeys.

trans-unit.source: FileCreateShortcut() does not require a valid target, workdir, icon, or hotkey in order to "successfully" create the LNK file; however, the destination of the LNK file must be valid! If the hotkey you choose is already in use, your new shortcut takes precedence. Also, if you create a shortcut with the same path\name as as a pre-existing shortcut, it gets overwritten with your new version.

seg-source.mrk: FileCreateShortcut() does not require a valid target, workdir, icon, or hotkey in order to "successfully" create the LNK file; however, the destination of the LNK file must be valid!
If the hotkey you choose is already in use, your new shortcut takes precedence.
Also, if you create a shortcut with the same path\name as as a pre-existing shortcut, it gets overwritten with your new version.

target.mrk: FileCreateShortcut() does not require a valid target, workdir, icon, or hotkey in order to "successfully" create the LNK file; however, the destination of the LNK file must be valid!
If the hotkey you choose is already in use, your new shortcut takes precedence.
Also, if you create a shortcut with the same path\name as as a pre-existing shortcut, it gets overwritten with your new version.

trans-unit.source: Create a constant variable in Local scope of the shortcut filepath.

seg-source.mrk: Create a constant variable in Local scope of the shortcut filepath.

target.mrk: Create a constant variable in Local scope of the shortcut filepath.

trans-unit.source: Create a shortcut on the desktop to explorer.exe and set the hotkey combination Ctrl+Alt+T or in AutoIt ^!t to the shortcut.

seg-source.mrk: Create a shortcut on the desktop to explorer.exe and set the hotkey combination Ctrl+Alt+T or in AutoIt ^!t to the shortcut.

target.mrk: Create a shortcut on the desktop to explorer.exe and set the hotkey combination Ctrl+Alt+T or in AutoIt ^!t to the shortcut.
